pr_title: Cache the fuel time map in the fuel registry

timeline.message: Cache the fuel time map in the fuel registry
Use a faster map for the fuel times

timeline.bodyText:
Have you tested if this event is emitted on a client when it receives the tags on game-join from the server?
@i509VCB Since you are the event-master, do you know this off the top of your head?
timeline.author: shartte

replies.bodyText: It doesn't, but 824377e addresses this issue!
replies.author: Technici4n

timeline.message: Rebuild the fuel times map on the client side too

timeline.bodyText: Can't all of these turn into 1 single mixin at AbstractFurnaceBlockEntity#createFuelTimeMap returning the cached map?
timeline.author: shedaniel

replies.bodyText: It's a possibility. I'm not fond of it because it "leaks" an implementation detail (i.e. the cached map).
replies.author: Technici4n

replies.bodyText: We would have to return an immutable map in this case which may change the semantics of anyone using the furnace. As such I'd probably just add getters in the fuel registry
replies.author: i509VCB

timeline.bodyText: This is effectively an overwrite, should be an inject

replies.bodyText: I don't think it's possible to inject here because the apply method is a default from an interface. I tried injecting there first, but injection into default interface methods is not supported yet AFAIK.
replies.author: Technici4n

replies.bodyText: You are targeting an anonymous class? It should be possible to inject here I think. Of course I may be wrong
replies.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: So I injected into ClientNetworkPlayHandler and used the END_DATA_PACK_RELOAD event. That removes the need for the overwrite.
replies.author: Technici4n

timeline.bodyText: Both new injects are soft overwrites, any other mod injecting here will never be handled.
timeline.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Would it be better to inject just before createFuelTimeMap ? That should work too.
replies.author: Technici4n

replies.bodyText: But if I were to do that, any mod injecting at TAIL for example still wouldn't work I think. Is it really reasonable to expect mods to be injecting stuff in these two functions?
replies.author: Technici4n

replies.bodyText: If you want I can lower the priority on the mixin itself... that works too, doesn't it?
replies.author: Technici4n

timeline.message: Replace a function overwrite by a TAIL inject

timeline.bodyText: I personally dislike it but modmuss wants the mixin annotations to be one line

timeline.message:
Make cache thread-safe, switch to boxed collection (IHM) since most
uses yield boxed results, refactor cache clearing
